name: Miley Cyrus
description:
'''Miley Ray Cyrus''' ({{IPAc-en|'|m|aɪ|l|i|_|'|s|aɪ|r|ə|s}} {{respell|MY|lee|_|SY|rəs}}, born '''Destiny Hope Cyrus'''; November 23, 1992) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. An influential figure in [[popular music]], Cyrus is known for her evolving artistry and image reinventions. She was an established [[child actress]] before developing a successful entertainment career as an adult. Cyrus emerged as a [[teen idol]] as [[Miley Stewart]] in the [[Disney Channel]] television series ''[[Hannah Montana]]'' (2006–2011), growing a profitable franchise and achieving two number-one soundtracks on the [[Billboard charts|''Billboard'' charts]].

Cyrus's solo career began with her US number-one [[pop rock]] albums ''[[Hannah Montana 2: Meet Miley Cyrus|Meet Miley Cyrus]]'' (2007) and ''[[Breakout (Miley Cyrus album)|Breakout]]'' (2008). The single "[[Party in the U.S.A.]]" from her EP ''[[The Time of Our Lives (EP)|The Time of Our Lives]]'' (2009) was certified [[List of best-selling singles in the United States|14-times platinum]] in the US. She sought a mature image with her [[dance-pop]] album ''[[Can't Be Tamed]]'' (2010) and later transitioned to [[hip hop]] and [[contemporary R&B|R&B]] with ''[[Bangerz]]'' (2013), which featured "[[We Can't Stop]]" and her first [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one "[[Wrecking Ball (Miley Cyrus song)|Wrecking Ball]]". Her later albums include ''[[Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz]]'' (2015), ''[[Younger Now]]'' (2017), and ''[[Plastic Hearts]]'' (2020). After signing with [[Columbia Records]], she released her eighth studio album ''[[Endless Summer Vacation]]'' (2023), led by her second US number-one single "[[Flowers (Miley Cyrus song)|Flowers]]". The song won two [[Grammy Awards]], including [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]]. Her ninth studio album, ''[[Something Beautiful (Miley Cyrus album)|Something Beautiful]]'' (2025), is a [[visual album]].

As an actress and television personality, Cyrus starred in the films ''[[Bolt (2008 film)|Bolt]]'' (2008), ''[[Hannah Montana: The Movie]]'' (2009), ''[[The Last Song (2010 film)|The Last Song]]'' (2010), ''[[LOL (2012 film)|LOL]]'' (2012), and ''[[So Undercover]]'' (2013). On television, she was the subject of the documentary ''[[Miley: The Movement]]'' (2013), led the miniseries ''[[Crisis in Six Scenes]]'' (2017), served as a coach on two seasons of ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'' (2016–2017), and starred in the "[[Rachel, Jack and Ashley Too]]" episode of ''[[Black Mirror]]'' (2019). She also hosted the holiday special ''[[Miley's New Year's Eve Party]]'' (2021–2022). 

Cyrus has received [[List of awards and nominations received by Miley Cyrus|various accolades]], including three Grammy Awards, one [[Brit Award]], five [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], three [[MTV Video Music Awards]], and eight ''[[Guinness World Records]]''. She was named a [[Disney Legends|Disney Legend]] and ranked as the ninth-greatest [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] female artist and among the [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars of the 21st Century|greatest pop stars of the 21st century]] by ''Billboard''. Cyrus is also the eighth-highest-certified female [[List of highest-certified music artists in the United States#Top 50 certified music artists (digital singles)|digital singles]] artist by the RIAA. She has featured in listicles such as the [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] (2008 and 2014) and [[Forbes Celebrity 100|''Forbes'' Celebrity 100]] (2010 and 2015). In 2014, she founded the [[Happy Hippie Foundation]], focusing on the [[LGBTQ community]] and [[youth homelessness]].
